intro: Stenostephanus reflexiflorus, commonly known as the reflexiflorus starflower, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes species such as willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its star-shaped, reflexed petals that give it its common name. Its flowers typically bloom in late spring or early summer, and it prefers moist, well-drained soils. Stenostephanus reflexiflorus is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
